RedoxRRI 0.99.0

Simulate a holobiont redox dataset with spatio-temporal structure

Source: R/simulate_redox_holobiont.R
simulate_redox_holobiont.Rd

Generates a synthetic plant–soil–microbe dataset with realistic properties commonly encountered in redox ecology and holobiont studies.

simulate_redox_holobiont(
  n_plot = 4,
  n_depth = 2,
  n_plant = 5,
  n_time = 15,
  p_micro = 60,
  seed = 123,
  include_graph = FALSE
)

Arguments

n_plot

Integer >= 1. Number of plots.

n_depth

Integer equal to 1 or 2. Number of soil depths (shallow/deep).

n_plant

Integer >= 1. Number of plants per plot–depth.

n_time

Integer >= 2. Number of time points per plant.

p_micro

Integer >= 1. Number of microbial features (e.g. ASVs).

seed

Optional integer seed; use NULL for stochastic simulation.

include_graph

Logical. If TRUE and igraph is available, returns a network.

Value

A named list with components:

id

data.frame of sample identifiers: plot, depth, plant_id, time.

ROS_flux

data.frame of plant physiological traits.

Eh_stability

data.frame of soil redox chemistry variables.

micro_data

data.frame of zero-inflated microbial abundances.

latent_truth

Numeric vector scaled to \([0,1]\) representing latent redox state.

graph

Optional igraph object (system-level network).

Examples

set.seed(1)
sim <- simulate_redox_holobiont(seed = 1)
str(sim)
#> List of 6
